title.narrative: 1.2 PREVENTION VIOLENCE PROGRAMMES

description.narrative: Selected municipalities have capacity to implement a validated strategy for the prevention of and protection from violence against children and adolescents, including gender-based violence, as part of the framework established by the National Integral Protection System, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and Adolescents i the most violent municipalities have increased access to protection systems allowing them to live free from violence, abuse, exploitation, and neglect, with a particular focus on gender-based violence

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Selected municipalities have capacity to implement a validated strategy for the prevention of and protection from violence againstchildren and adolescents, including gender-based violence, as part of the framework established by the National Integral ProtectionSystem

description.narrative: The child and adolescent rights and gender-based violence prevention model has been implemented in ten municipalities with high incidences of violence, internal displacement, and migration, and has successfully leveraged and improved coordination amongst municipality and community actors, schools, families, and private sector entities. UNICEF has successfully supported the Salvadorean Institute for the Comprehensive Development of Children and Adolescents (ISNA) in developing an evidence-based reintegration model for children in conflict with the law | Status:Met | As-of Date:01/02/2022
